title.narrative: DESIGN SCALING UP PLANS OF NUTRITION INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: By 2022, key strategic actors in the nutrition sector are equipped with the technical skills to use data to design strategies and carry out decentralized monitoring., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, key strategic actors in the nutrition sector are equipped with the technical skills to use data to design strategies andcarry out decentralized monitoring.

description.narrative: During year 2021, UNICEF had continued to support activities under the initiative "stronger with breastmilk only" both at national and in the thirteen regions of the country. To address social norms related to infant and young child feeding practices, UNICEF had supported five strategic workshops;with 175 traditional and religious leaders at national level, as well as in four regions of the country (Boucle du Mouhoun, Hauts Bassins, Sud Ouest and Centre Est). A nutrition Champion was nominated in each region of the 13 regions of the country, who will continue to coordinate promotional and counselling nutrition activities. ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
